T2: Trainspotting was good. A satisfying epilogue. At times not quite worthy of a full sequel but never unwelcome. Enjoyed it a lot.

Google Amp feels like the wrong way to solve a problem. Is it opt-in for websites or do they just harvest content? Can I opt-out as a user?

"Mystery.. mystery.. myst... Ah, never mind. Let's just wrap this up, yeah? Don't forget your sentimental montage on the way out. Kthxbi".
Enjoyed that last episode of Sherlock, although they just seemed to give up on the story 10 minutes before the end.
What the “Santa Clausification” of MLK, Jr. Leaves Out - (he also fought for economic justice and against war) - https://t.co/eMdbEJlg3z
La La Land was great! Beautiful, lovely, fun, and engaging.
Watched "Manchester By The Sea". Good film. Longer than it needed to be. Serious drama stuff. Could do with a unicorn chaser by the end.
@prendio2 Who the fuck is that guy and why does he have your first iPhone?
@forbairt (although I'm sure I could figure it out ;-))
@forbairt That's probably the only thing I do with it! It is useful though. I'm not really sure how to set a timer manually anymore.
Watched Silence last night. Masterful filmmaking. A real treat to see in the cinema.
@damienmulley @suzybie @Twitter I've seen "faved by someone-you-know" before. Today there was a tweet without any note. Maybe just a blip.
@suzybie @Twitter Noticed that today too. I recognised the author but I don't follow them.
@TouchingVirus and for instance they put the 2D version of Rough One in the biggest screen, 3D in the smaller. Warms my heart.
.@TouchingVirus ... Man Who Fell to Earth, and Goodfellas is out next week). I was worried I'd miss out on some big movies but not at all.
.@TouchingVirus MUCH nicer cinema experience. More emphasis on *good* films vs blockbuster films. Classic screenings (have seen 2001, ...
@LightHouseD7 Absolutely. Silence tonight, then difficult choices between La La Land, Monster Calls, and Manchester… https://t.co/9F5fRi0sFg
As a regular cinema goer, best thing I've done recently was ditch the megaplex monthly sub and get a @LightHouseD7 membership instead.
Yahoo isn't really going away (at least, not yet) https://t.co/aDsCht1NzS via @Verge
@amyhoy @ideasasylum yeah, that crossed my mind as soon as the tweet sent ;-). Happy where I am for the moment but it is a near-term goal.

@dclay Girl on a Train, because I haven't seen it and it looks good. Otherwise Star Wars because it's good fun.

OK, yeah, that is much better. Same story, better told. https://t.co/I3nRjQHbZs
@davebolger @paulmwatson OTT outrage is fuel to the fire for these assholes.
@paulmwatson Fair enough. The article just doesn't merrit the outrage imo, nor match the choice scrnshots. But that… https://t.co/Gxt4k8AghS

The Man Who Fell to Earth in @LightHouseD7 this weekend. Nice one!
https://t.co/wYEVCaOrIQ
@paulmwatson it's reporting on an "offensive, influential, and reactionary group" which exists and is "outrageous and frequently offensive".

@davebolger continues "confrontational, outrageous and frequently offensive" in second paragraph.
Where's the endorsement bit I'm missing?
@davebolger but these people exist, and those terms exist. Article mentions "offensive, influential, and reactionary" in it's byline.

Should we also pretend they're non-existent?
Anyway. I should know better than to wade into this nonsense on Twitter tbh.
Sure they're controversial terms and definitions but clearly described in TFA as offensive, nationalist, confrontational, and outrageous.
@jamiestantonian @IrishTimesWorld Search 'Irish Times' on twitter for the outrage.
@jamiestantonian Glossary of terms used by the alt-right, which didn't to me seem to endorse or encourage anything. https://t.co/53LCbtIKc2

Worker and Workers. Client and Clients. Job and Jobs.
Nice.
"Hm. Workers sounds bad. Lets change that to Staff."
Staffs.
(╯°□°)╯︵ ┻━┻
@paulmwatson Cheapest, lazy way to pass that "apartment has heating" requirement. And still €1250/m for a 1 bedroom… https://t.co/pI4YIVGuJt
Storage heaters are a bloody insult to tenants. Never would anybody buy these things for a property they intend to live in themselves.

@jamiestantonian thanks for the all clear, laddie. I think I nailed it!
FFFRRREEEEEDDOMMMM!! https://t.co/laKFoh1uTA
@feylya @AmericanGodsTV – Ian McShane! Cool!
And it's now over 10 years of my listening history, which I can export in a neat json format. That's cool.
Last.fm is great. Love that I can forget all about it and it just continues to do it's thing. Never intrudes or oversteps it's usefulness.
My year in music, via Last.fm: https://t.co/aJIbeqy57L
I like my flat a lot but living under a family with two young kids, wooden floors, little push scooters, and a tendency to tantrum, is shit.
We'll meet again, Don't know where, don't know when, But I know we'll meet again, some sunny day. https://t.co/YgcUnLGOrj
@LastPassHelp Is it possible to disable the pop-up and use an unobtrusive system notification icon instead?
@LastPassHelp thanks. Popping up on non-password forms isn't really the issue though. The pop-up is annoying all the time.
The @LastPass "Matching Logins" pop-up on Android is infuriating. Can it not use the standard notifications system? Is there a setting?
@jeffrey_way ah, gotcha. Yeah. Thought you might be an arrow keys holdout in vim. Took me the longest time to switch but haven't looked back
@jeffrey_way don't you use vim/vim-mode? If you can get used to hjkl and other keys for nav, it really is great.
@steve228uk well. Good luck to 'em I guess. Must be fun to be so sure of yourself.

@steve228uk like, a tracker/ad blocker? I use all the time! Great!
But "better, FYI" and "protecting you from unethical website" – hrm :-/
@steve228uk think so? Definitely something unlikable and condescending about their whole message. I do wonder if it's just an image problem.
Who decides what's ethical on the likes of https://t.co/8XihpLeci1? Pretty sure I hate the idea of outsourcing that decision.
@VirginMediaIE yeah, a reboot fixed things earlier. Thanks.
Is @VirginMediaIE having broadband issues again this evening or is it just me this time?

@dclay and yet... there's just something about the guy I can't help but trust.
I'm gonna give him a loan.

Have tried unplugging and replugging all cables. No use. It not an all-the-time problem but it is frequent enough.

@MarcoTroisi I've tried that in the past without any luck.
I rebooted. Lost the focus I had all morning.

MBP not recognising external HDMI monitor after waking from sleep.
Anyone have a solution? Only one I know is a restart and I hate that.
@Ciarancoyle sure I'll pick up the road anyway, see how I get on. Haven't seen the film yet either. Heard it's a right aul laugh.
@Ciarancoyle I could do with a book. Good one of his to start with?
Been a long time since I've seen Blue Velvet. Looking forward to it tonight, with an appropriate amount of trepidation, in @LightHouseD7.

That's be fine but writing tests after the fact is dull as dishwater. Red/green TDD is, by comparison at least, lots of fun.

Front end devs: do you use TDD?
I find it great on backend but my front-end tends to be more an emergent thing. Maybe lack of discipline.

@duggan ah, OK. Cheers. That's less interesting than it could have been :-)
